main event: A young boy and his mother observed a bright gold object in Vista, California on February 2, 1963.
interesting points: The object's shape resembled a car cupola, emitting a sharp halo of light around it., The sighting was initially reported by the boy on February 3, but the actual event occurred on February 2., Winds in the area were from 010 degrees at 5 knots during the time of the sighting., The object was described as being somewhat larger than a star and stood still over the city for approximately 5 to 10 minutes., The possibility of the sighted object being a hot air balloon was suggested in the report.
sighted object: a bright gold object resembling a car cupola
witness description: a young boy and his mother
